thread.title: Several B-Sens off to hot starts offensively
thread.title_full: Several B-Sens off to hot starts offensively

title: Several B-Sens off to hot starts offensively
text:
Several B-Sens off to hot starts offensively Matt Weinstein, mweinstein@gannett.com | @SteinTime44 1:09 a.m. EDT October 24, 2015 B-Sens play back-to-back days starting Saturday Eric O'Dell from the B-Senlbany battle for the puck at the B-Sens home opener (Photo: Jeff Miller/Correspondent Photo) Eric O'Dell leads Binghamton with four goals Rookie Tobias Lindberg has assisted on each of O'Dell's four goals CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Binghamton Senators are only four games into the 2015-16 American Hockey League season, and their top offensive line is already playing up to expectations. 
Center Eric O'Dell, left winger Ryan Dzingel and rookie right winger Tobias Lindberg have been on the ice for a third of the B-Sens' 12 goals this season and are starting to resemble a formidable line from two seasons earlier. 
Not since the Mike Hoffman-Stephane Da Costa-Mark Stone line in the 2013-14 season has a Binghamton line produced at a near point-per-game pace for an extended period time, but the current trio definitely has the potential to keep up the production. Time will tell if they will get the opportunity at the next level. 
Stone led all National Hockey League rookies in points and Hoffman led all rookies in goals last season for the Ottawa Senators, and both are averaging more than a point per game this season. Da Costa left the organization to play in the Kontinental Hockey League last season and finished fourth in the league in scoring for CSKA Moscow. 
O'Dell is among several players in the AHL tied for fourth in the league in goals with four. Lindberg has assisted on all four goals and Dzingel has assisted on three of them. The line has produced a goal in three of the team's four games this season. 
Along with O'Dell and Lindberg, right winger Colin Greening (2 goals, 2 assists) and defenseman Patrick Mullen (0-4) are also producing at point-per-game averages through four games. 
The B-Sens (2-2-0-0) host the Toronto Marlies (3-1-0-0) on Saturday night at 7:05 and then travel to the capital of New York for a 3 p.m. start against the Albany Devils (1-1-1-0). 
HOCKEY NIGHT 
WHAT: Toronto Marlies at Binghamton Senators 
WHEN/WHERE: 7:05 p.m. Saturday at Floyd L. Maines Veterans Memorial Arena 
RADIO: WINR 96.9 FM and 680 AM 
TICKETS: $20 for side seating ($21 on game day), $19 for end seating ($20 on game day), $2 discount for youths under 12. Call 607-722-7367, visit the Arena box office or go to www.ticketmaster.com. 
PROMOTIONS: Post-game open skate (must bring your own skates). Read or Share this story: http://press.sn/1RZc4LL TOP VIDEOS
